result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Michael F Murphy III

records.addlTxt:
3:16 PM Defendant Michael F Murphy III not in court.  Prosecuting attorney Jayne Davis Dewire in court for the State of Wisconsin. 

State motions the Court to issue a warrant for the defendant and to forfeit bail.
The Court will issue a bench warrant and forfeit bail.
EXT CODE 3.

The Court quashes the warrant.
ADA Dewire states that Mr. Murphy has paid the up front restitution. 

Prosecuting attorney and Defendant stipulate to the amended charge of Theft contrary to section 13.102(c)(12)  of the Waukesha County Code of Ordinances.  
Court approves amendment.  
No contest plea entered.  
Court finds the defendant guilty.  

Court orders the following fine:
$210.80 to be paid within 30 days or civil judgment entered for penalty for non payment of fine.
Effective August 1, 2022, this case is assigned to Branch 7 Judicial Vacancy, pursuant to 22-SO-04(67).
Pre-trial conference on August 26, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

03:52 PM Defendant Michael F Murphy in court.  Alyssa M Jay appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

ADA Jay states that up front restitution to be paid.
The Defendant concurs.
The Court will adjourn.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for August 26, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Pre-trial conference on June 10, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant to have no contact with Goodwill listed in the Criminal Complaint.  Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia.

02:27 PM Defendant Michael F Murphy in court.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint.  Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties.  Court advises of right to an attorney.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED BY COURT.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for June 10, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
11:29 AM Defendant Michael F Murphy not in court.  Andrew Nesheim appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
State's Demand for Discovery and Inspection and Notice of Intent to Use Defendant's Statement and DNA Evidence.
records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Prosecutor
